content: guernsey style baby blanket- by kate mcdaid a beautiful unisex baby blanket in guernsey or gansey patterns this classic blanket knits up fast in a bulky weight yarn and the knit/purl pattern provides great texture the yarn is also machine washable to make things easier for new moms difficulty level easy size 24 x 25 yarn 4 skeins of berroco vintage chunky in oats 136yrds/ 125m per ball or any other bulky weight yarn that obtains gauge needles us 8 5mm needles gauge 17 sts and 28 5 row per 4 inches 10cm use needle size needed to obtain correct gauge pattern special pattern notes the first and last 2 stitches of the blanket are done in garter stitch to be worked on all row except the first and last 4 row the 3rd stitch and 3rd last stitch are a stockinette stitch border to be worked on all row except the first and last 4 row so it looks like this for all but the first and last 4 row rs k3 work chart 12 times k3 ws k2 p1 work chart 12 times p1 k2 cast on 102 sts using long tail cast on work 4 row in garter stitch **work diamond chart #1 12 times across the blanket remembering the special pattern notes work diamond chart #1 for the full 16 row *between chart row- remember special pattern notes purl 1 row knit 2 row purl 2 row knit 1 row always working the first and last 3 stitches in pattern * work diamond chart #2 12 times across the blanket remembering the special pattern notes work diamond chart #2 for the full 16 row *between chart row* work diamond chart #3 12 times across the blanket remembering the special pattern notes work diamond chart #3 for the full 16 row *between chart row* work diamond chart #4 12 times across the blanket remembering the special pattern notes work diamond chart #4 for the full 16 row ** *between chart row* repeat from ** to ** this is one more of each diamond chart with the between chart row stop when you are done diamond chart #4 for the second time work the last 4 row in garter stitch not doing the special pattern notes cast off loosely weave in ends block in warm water lay flat to dry ©kate mcdaid 2015 this pattern is intended for personal use and is not to be reprinted or sold without the permission of the author key purl on right side knit on wrong side - knit on right side purl on wrong side- don t speak chart row by row instructions written further down **and remember in charting the rs row travel right to left across the chart the ws row travel left to right across the chart ** diamond chart #1 diamond chart #2 16 16 15 15 14 14 13 13 12 12 11 11 10 10 9 9 8 8 7 7 6 6 5 5
